visits.clinician_note:
Complaints & Symptoms:
29-year-old woman presents for routine 3-month follow-up after initiating ART. No complaints. Feeling well, energy improved since starting treatment.

Examination Findings:
BP 110/70 mmHg. Weight 68kg (pre-pregnancy weight 62kg). Fundal height appropriate for dates. Fetal movements present. No oedema. Urine dipstick negative for protein.

Significant history prior to today's visit:
HIV diagnosed 10 weeks ago during antenatal screening. Currently 22 weeks pregnant (second pregnancy, first child alive and well). No other medical conditions. No regular medications prior to ART. Taking ferrous sulfate and folic acid as prescribed.

labs_narrative.narrative_text: Creatinine: 1.1 mg/dL (baseline before ART: 0.8 mg/dL). eGFR: 78 mL/min/1.73m2. Urinalysis: Normal, no protein, no glucose. Viral load: 89 copies/mL (down from 125,000 at diagnosis). CD4: 389 cells/uL (was 312 at diagnosis). Hb: 10.8 g/dL. Phosphate: 3.8 mg/dL (normal).

intake.complaints_symptoms: 29-year-old woman presents for routine 3-month follow-up after initiating ART. No complaints. Feeling well, energy improved since starting treatment.
intake.examination_findings: BP 110/70 mmHg. Weight 68kg (pre-pregnancy weight 62kg). Fundal height appropriate for dates. Fetal movements present. No oedema. Urine dipstick negative for protein.
intake.prior_history: HIV diagnosed 10 weeks ago during antenatal screening. Currently 22 weeks pregnant (second pregnancy, first child alive and well). No other medical conditions. No regular medications prior to ART. Taking ferrous sulfate and folic acid as prescribed.

art_regimen_current: TDF/3TC/DTG (TLD) fixed-dose combination once daily. On this regimen for 3 years
other_medications: switched to TLD in 2020 due to national guideline transition.

visits.clinician_note:
Complaints & Symptoms:
38-year-old woman presents for routine 6-monthly review. No specific complaints. Mentions mild fatigue over the past 2 months which she attributes to her busy work schedule.

Examination Findings:
BP 118/76 mmHg. Weight 64kg (stable). No peripheral oedema. No costovertebral angle tenderness. Otherwise unremarkable.

Significant history prior to today's visit:
HIV diagnosed 2018. No diabetes, no hypertension. Adherence consistently >95% by pill count. No known allergies. Takes ibuprofen 400mg occasionally for headaches (approximately 2-3 times per week for the past 6 months due to work stress).

labs_narrative.narrative_text: Creatinine: 1.4 mg/dL (previous values: 0.9 in 2020, 1.0 in 2021, 1.1 in 2022, 1.2 in 2023). eGFR: 52 mL/min/1.73m2 (CKD-EPI). Urinalysis: Protein 1+, glucose trace. Viral load: <50 copies/mL. CD4: 584 cells/uL. Hb: 12.8 g/dL.

intake.complaints_symptoms: 38-year-old woman presents for routine 6-monthly review. No specific complaints. Mentions mild fatigue over the past 2 months which she attributes to her busy work schedule.
intake.examination_findings: BP 118/76 mmHg. Weight 64kg (stable). No peripheral oedema. No costovertebral angle tenderness. Otherwise unremarkable.
intake.prior_history: HIV diagnosed 2018. No diabetes, no hypertension. Adherence consistently >95% by pill count. No known allergies. Takes ibuprofen 400mg occasionally for headaches (approximately 2-3 times per week for the past 6 months due to work stress).
